verses.verse: A Psalme. O synge vnto the Lord a new songe, for he hath done maruelous thynges.
With hys awne ryght hande and wyth his holy arme hath he gotten hym selfe the victory.
The Lord declared hys saluacyon, his ryghteousnes hath he openly shewed in the syght of the Heathen.
He hath remembred hys mercy and trueth towarde the house of Israel: and all the endes of the worlde haue sene the saluacyon of oure God.
Shewe youre selues ioyfull vnto the Lorde all ye landes, synge, reioyse, and geue thankes.
Prayse the Lorde vpon the harpe, synge to the harpe wyth a psalme of thanckesgeuyng.
With trompettes also and shawmes: O shewe youre selues ioyfull before the Lorde the kynge.
Let the see make a noyse and all that therin is, the rounde worlde, and they that dwell therin.
Let the floudes clappe their handes, and let the hylles be ioyfull together. Before the Lord, for he is come to iudge the earth. Wyth ryghteousnes shall he iudge the worlde, & the people with equite.
